result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Competency Examination.

11:25 AM Defendant Patrick W Savage in court, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Patrick W Savage.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Doctor report received and review by the parties.
Defense has reviewed with defendant, requests additional status to look into hiring their own evaluator.  Defendant was found incompetent in his out of county cases.
Defense is raising competency again.
State requests to obtain copy of the report from the other county.
BTC: Competency evaluation ordered.  Defense to look into hiring a second evaluator regarding NGI plea.
Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements, by the State.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim K.S (person, property, residence or family). No contact with all minors under the age of 18. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Patrick W Savage appeared by video, in custody in KCDC, Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Patrick W Savage. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Defendant and counsel go into a private breakout room; off the record at 1:56PM
Back on the record at 2:05 PM, same appearances.
Defense counsel raises competency on the defendant
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. Competency evaluation ordered. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits based on the raised competency.
Competency hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Competency hearing on April 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance on March 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
